title: Our Reviewers on the Best in Spring Reading
sub_head: Memoirs of the baseball diamond, inspired rambles in nature, self-discovery in the garden and more books to usher in the season.
body:
To a gardener spring means green shoots, to a foodie it means spring vegetables, and to a baseball fan it means Opening Day. But to the avid reader it means one thing: some of the most anticipated books of the year.
Take a moment to smell the flowers—and to sample our guide to the season’s best books about baseball, food, gardening and more. Plus, Meghan Cox Gurdon finds colorful children’s books blossoming, and Christoph Irmscher feels the call of a walk in the woods, with two wonderful guides.
